template&lt;&gt; struct hash&lt;std::thread::id&gt;;

{{dcl end}}

The template specialization of {{lc|std::hash}} for the {{lc|std::thread::id}} class allows users to obtain hashes of the identifiers of threads.

===Example===
{{todo|example that uses hash meaningfully}}
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;thread&gt;
#include &lt;vector&gt;
using namespace std::chrono_literals;

void foo()
{
    std::this_thread::sleep_for(10ms);
}
 
int main()
{
    std::vector&lt;std::thread&gt; v;
    for (int n = 0; n &lt; 4; ++n)
        v.emplace_back(foo);

    std::hash&lt;std::thread::id&gt; hasher;
    for (auto&amp; t : v)
    {
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "thread " &lt;&lt; t.get_id() &lt;&lt; " hashes to "
                  &lt;&lt; hasher(t.get_id()) &lt;&lt; '\n';
        t.join();
    }
}  
|p=true
|output=
thread 139786440144640 hashes to 8905351942358389397
thread 139786431751936 hashes to 9222844670065909738
thread 139786423359232 hashes to 18199000599186780501
thread 139786414966528 hashes to 15386662774029264672
}}
